TITLE.P: RFI System for unemployment registration, payments and auditing of benefits, job search and counselling

SHORT_DESCR.P: Ríkiskaup on behalf of the Purchaser invites information from prospective bidder on a system for unemployment registration, payments and auditing of benefits, job search and counselling as further specified in this Request For Information (RFI).
The purpose of the RFI is to gather information on suitable systems for the Purchaser in order to be able to define a successful Request for Tender in the coming months.

The Directorate of Labour bears overall responsibility for public labour exchanges and handles day-to-day operations of the Unemployment Insurance Fund, the Maternity and Paternity Leave Fund, the Wage Guarantee Fund and many other projects connected with the labour market.
The Directorate attends to a range of responsibilities including the registration of job-seekers and the calculation and payment of unemployment benefit.
More about the directorate: www.vinnumalastofnun.is
Intent of RFI.

The Directorate of labour is looking for a System for unemployment registration, payments and auditing of benefits, job search and counselling to replace the current system in use. The current system is written in Visual Basic and has been in use for over 20 years.

The system allows unemployed persons to register and apply for unemployment benefits, as certain conditions are met. The system shall assist the user in creating a valid application. The application is processed by the Directorate employees. If the applicant is entitled to receiving unemployment benefits, the system calculates the correct amount and enables payments. Certain auditing functions are built into the system to ensure that all requirements are fulfilled and the correct benefits have been paid. The system shall also assist in job search and counselling for employment seekers.

The system should be built on general units. Admin access shall be provided both at the user level at the Directorate and for general users registering for benefit application or job search. Please describe the work environment provided for all users.
Various requirements will be made to the vendors, the system itself, its architecture and functionality.
Specific requirements.
High emphasis will be put on requirements such as:
— Self-service options for general users,
— An open and modular system connectable to systems and services in place at other organizations. APIs and web services are most important. Please send a list of all available services,
— As the new EU GDPR regulation (2016/679) comes into effect this year, compliance must be ensured in a system consortium setup,

— The Directorate of Labour places considerable value on the data which it holds. Cloud based system are certainly an option but must comply with government policy. All user data residing in a specified hosted cloud environment should preferably be under the management of an Icelandic public sector body.
Participants are welcome to share further information if available.
Questions for prospective bidders.
1. Name of system, version number and date of latest version;
2. When was your system first implemented;
3. System environment, architecture, programming environment, data base support. Is the system designed using open standards?
4. Is your system client server based, browser based or a combination of both?
5. Which operating systems are supported, which browsers?
6. Number of institutions (countries) using your system and size of installations in users
7. Is the system in use in Europe? In Scandinavia? In the USA?
8. How does your system comply with known and open standards?
9. Describe how your system is built up with regards to main system units, scalability and flexibility? Is it necessary to acquire all system units?
10. Does the system allow cloud based operations and/or local installation
11. Describe the systems access control mechanism? Can user groups with different rights and access to functionality be defined and created by system management?
12. Does the system support full audit trails on each and any database field including access control database?

INFO_ADD.P: Prospective tenderers are asked to provide all information via e-mail before April 6th: utbod@rikiskaup.is
